Been playing this game for a while now. Started playing after F13 died down. It's a great game, fun to play. I have had issues in the past of the game crashing for no reason. At one point every time I would enter a match, the frame rate would go down extremely low and then crash. Hopefully it won't happen anymore, it seemed to have been fixed. The only real bad point I can think of is that the other players can be jerks sometimes, especially to new people. But the character customization and leveling up is pretty good and rewarding. Tasks and challenges are great too. I'd say give it a try. Especially if you liked Friday the 13th before it basically died.

Dentro de todo esto el al juego le doy un 7,5 por las horas que propone y si se juega con amigos se hace mucho mas divertido.

This game is amazing in many ways, there are several characters to choose from (in the way of Survivor and killer). It has very high replayability as long as you have at least another person to play with. On the downside there are several bugs that they do fix very quick but the point stands. Also, there NEEDS to be more game modes to make the replayability better by yourself. A proximity chat would also be nice, but I do understand why it doesn't have it (boosters). All together i'd give this game a 8/10.

I love this game, it is a deep and heartfelt love of a game that has become so dear to me. Once upon a time I would have written something to encourage more and more people to join me and share in my love of the interesting gameplay concept, the wide variety of licensed and original characters, and the feral joy of hunting my friends in custom lobbies on occasion. The game has changed a lot since then, sometimes for the better, not always for the best. To anyone looking at this game from the outside wondering if they should purchase this game, I would suggest you wait. Dead by Daylight may very well be in the most poorly balanced state it has been since launch, this community is so divided, survivor versus killer and vice versa, and the developers seem tonally deaf to much of the core problems to the game. The developers seem to love this game as much as I can tell however, and I hope they can see what needs to be done for them to make a perfectly fun game for both killer and survivor. For all its faults I still love this game, I've spent as is ~750 hours playing, and even returned each time after having my data corrupted twice. I hope that the times this community currently finds itself in is nothing more than a low point in the game's history, and to anyone that would like to start playing this game, hold on a bit for me before you start playing, first impressions are everything, and the impression as of writing will not be the greatest. Maybe I'll see you in The Fog one day in a better state~
